title: 32 candidates to get cut, traded and passed over this NFL offseason: Names to watch on every team

title: Shiffrin ends Olympic drought with slalom gold
content: Mikaela Shiffrin put in two dominant runs to win the Olympic women's slalom by 1.50 seconds and end a wait for another medal that stretched back to 2018.

title: KC reworks Mahomes deal for massive cap room
content: The Chiefs restructured Patrick Mahomes' contract this week, creating much-needed salary cap space ahead of the 2026 season, according to ESPN and multiple reports.

title: UCLA's Cronin ejects own player after flagrant foul
content: UCLA coach Mick Cronin sent Bruins center Steven Jamerson II to the locker room after he fouled Carson Cooper from behind on a dunk attempt late in Tuesday night's blowout loss to Michigan State.

title: Klaebo joins Phelps as only 10-gold Olympians
content: Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo won a 10th gold medal in cross country skiing, putting him in an exclusive group with swimming great Michael Phelps.

title: Kyrie to miss rest of season, eyes '26-27 return

title: Wolfdog steals show, crosses Olympic finish line
content: A large dog ran onto the track during cross-country team qualifying Wednesday at the Milan Cortina Olympics, running alongside athletes as they crossed the finish line.

title: MLBPA head Clark resigns after internal inquiry
content: MLBPA executive director Tony Clark has resigned after an internal investigation revealed an inappropriate relationship with his sister-in-law, who was hired by the union in 2023, sources told ESPN.

content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: Barcelona transfer questions: Let Lewandowski, Rashford go? Sign a top striker or defender?
content: Everything seemed to be falling into place for Barcelona, but losing the top spot in LaLiga has exposed squad issues that must be addressed this summer.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG, Liverpool join race for Villa star Rogers
content: Paris Saint-Germain and Liverpool have joined the race to sign Aston Villa attacking midfielder Morgan Rogers.

title: "Kinetic Action" In Next Few Weeks? US Preps For Iran Military Ops: Report
content: The United States could be closer to launching a full-scale attack in the Middle East than most Americans think. A report on Axios citing sources mentions that a US military operation in Iran would be a "massive, weeks-long campaign".

title: Will AI Kill Smartphones In Next 10 Years? What Nothing India Chief Told NDTV
content: Smartphones will remain the "main gateway" to the next generation of operating systems, according to Akis Evangelidis, co-founder and President of Nothing India.

title: Opportunities Or 'Losing Control'? Industry Leaders' Prediction On Future Of AI
content: Agentic AI, or artificial intelligence with immensely capable agents that act as force-multipliers, can raise concerns due to the fear of humanity losing control, industry leaders at the NDTV Ind.AI Summit said today.

title: Civic Poll Verdict Seen As Acid Test For Revanth Reddy Government
content: The polls were held on February 12, and elections to the posts of chairpersons, mayors and their deputies were completed on February 16, with voting in 11 municipalities postponed by the State Election Commission.

title: AI A Knife, It Can Be Used To Butter Bread Or Kill: Norway Minister To NDTV
content: Norway's Minister of Digitalisation and Public Governance Karianne Oldernes Tung believes India's AI Impact Summit has sent a powerful signal to the world: that the future of AI must be collaborative, inclusive and grounded in trust.

title: Sarpanch From AAP Shot Dead At Wedding In Punjab's Tarn Taran
content: A sarpanch from a village in Punjab's Tarn Taran, belonging to the ruling Aam Aadmi Party, was shot dead by two unidentified assailants during a wedding.

title: South African Cheetah Gamini Births 5 Cubs, Number In Kuno Park Now 38
content: On the third anniversary of the arrival of South African cheetahs in India, a female cheetah translocated from South Africa, has given birth to three healthy cubs inside Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park.

title: "Disorganised PR Spectacle": Rahul Gandhi On Galgotias' Chinese Robot Row
content: Amid the rising controversy over Galgotias University allegedly presenting Chinese-made robotic dog as its own invention at the AI Impact Summit, LoP Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi called it a "disorganised PR spectacle".

title: "AI Can Turn Me Into A Murthy Family Level Physics Tutor": Rishi Sunak At NDTV AI Summit
content: Rishi Sunak, the former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, told NDTV today that his use of AI even includes lesson preps for his daughter's school-level physics.

title: "Chernobyl-Scale Disaster" Warning In AI Guru Stuart Russell's Note To World
content: The world does not have an answer yet to what would happen to humanity if machines start 'thinking', UC Berkeley professor Stuart Russell said at the NDTV Ind.AI Summit today.

title: The Hormuz Threat: Iran's Most Powerful Card Against The US
content: Two American carrier strike groups are now positioned within operational reach of Iran. One, the USS Abraham Lincoln, has been tracked roughly 700 kilometres from the Iranian coastline.

title: India Is Central To The Future Of AI Innovation: Former US AI Advisor Krystle Veda Kaul
content: At a time when artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping geopolitics, defence, and global commerce, the scale and ambition of India's AI Impact Summit in New Delhi has sent a strong signal to the world.

title: Odisha Woman Fights Off Bear With Axe To Save Husband
content: Malde Soren and his wife, Lili Soren, had ventured into the forest to collect leaves when they suddenly encountered a group of six wild bears.

title: Galgotias Apologises After Robot Row, Says Rep Neha Singh "Ill-Informed"
content: Greater Noida-based Galgotias University has issued a public apology, blaming one of its own staff members for falsely presenting a Chinese-made robotic dog as an in-house innovation at a major government-backed AI summit.

title: "Representative Was Ill Informed": Galgotias Apologises Over Chinese Robot Dog Row
content: A row has erupted at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, after Galgotias University showcased 'Orion', a Chinese-made robotic dog as a product developed by the its Centre of Excellence.

title: India Will Have "Extraordinary Trajectory" With AI: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
content: Pointing out that there is a very high adoption of, and optimism for, AI technologies in India, Pichai said they present a chance for the country to "leapfrog age-old gaps" and create new opportunities.

title: "If I Can Keep Up In Family Dinners, I Can Handle Summits": Rishi Sunak At NDTV AI Summit
content: Rishi Sunak, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, spoke at length on India's potential in the field of artificial intelligence or AI, saying the country is "well positioned to take a leadership role".

title: Madhya Pradesh Bets On 'Dwarka', 'Yashoda' Schemes In Rs 4.38 Lakh Crore Budget
content: Madhya Pradesh's Rs 4,38,317 crore budget for 2026-27 has ignited sharp political debate, as the Mohan Yadav government unveiled a welfare-heavy financial plan layered with strong religious symbolism and ambitious spending commitments.

title: "What'll You Do?" Man's Unsettling Calm After Raping, Killing MBA Girlfriend
content: The cameras were already rolling when Piyush Dhamnotiya stepped into view. He did not attempt to hide his face. He did not lower his voice. Instead, he smiled faintly and spoke in a tone that was unsettlingly calm.

title: US-Iran war will be massive, could last weeks; Israel may join offensive: Report
content: Tensions escalate as US officials warn of a massive, weeks-long military operation against Iran, potentially alongside Israel, targeting its nuclear and missile programs. Diplomatic talks are ongoing but face significant hurdles, with a 90% chance of kinetic action predicted by some advisors. Israel also prepares for imminent conflict.

title: India turns away from Russia? Data show 3-yr dip in oil import share; who's filling the gap
content: India has significantly reduced its reliance on Russian crude oil, with January imports hitting their lowest point since late 2022. This shift sees Middle Eastern suppliers, particularly Saudi Arabia, regaining prominence as India diversifies its energy sources. The move aligns with international pressures and India's commitment to strategic autonomy.

title: NPS: Not just a tax-saving tool ‚Äî new rules, retirement benefits & more explained
content: As India's private sector workforce steps into a new era of financial independence, individuals are urged to take charge of their retirement savings. The National Pension System (NPS) stands out as a strategic investment choice, boasting market-driven returns and offering recent updates that enhance user flexibility.

title: Anthropic answers why it is hiring engineers when 'Claude Code is writing 100% of code'
content: Anthropic's AI, Claude Code, now generates nearly all internal code, prompting questions about its 100+ open engineering roles. Executives clarify human engineers are crucial for prompting, customer interaction, and strategic decisions. This shift elevates engineers to focus on system design and product direction, with AI handling repetitive coding tasks.  The trend signifies a significant evolution in software development.

title: 'Be powerful, abandon rest': RSS chief on 'thinking' of US, China
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has criticised the United States and China. He stated that Western countries spread fundamentalism. Bhagwat asserted India possesses solutions to global problems. He called for accelerating 'Ghar Wapsi'. Bhagwat also urged Hindus to have at least three children. He emphasized strengthening India in all areas to become a world leader.

title: 'We've beaten India once, unlike our ex-cricketers': Shadab hits back at Afridi
content: Shadab Khan responded strongly to criticism from Mohammad Yousuf and Shahid Afridi after Pakistan‚Äôs loss to India, defending senior players and the team‚Äôs process. The all-rounder cited Pakistan‚Äôs lone World Cup win over India in 2021, brushed aside external criticism, and stressed that the team remains focused on winning the T20 World Cup.

title: Google Pixel 10a launched: Price in India, specs and all you need to know
content: Google Pixel 10a is now available in India. This new smartphone brings advanced Google AI to more users. It boasts durability and the largest battery ever in an A-series phone. Priced at Rs 49,999, it offers a zero down payment upgrade program. The Pixel 10a features a tough design, a bright display, and the Tensor G5 chip.

title: This day, that year: When India launched the world‚Äôs first official airmail service
content: In 1911, Prayagraj witnessed the world's first official airmail service, a 13-minute flight by French aviator Henri Pequet carrying 6,500 letters. This pioneering event, staged at the UP Exhibition, marked a significant leap from pigeon post, demonstrating the potential of powered flight to conquer distance and reshape global communication.  The historic flight launched a new era in postal history.

title: After BMC setback, Raj Thackeray meets Eknath Shinde amid MNS unease
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray met Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde in Mumbai, marking their first interaction since the BMC elections. The meeting, which covered various issues, follows MNS's support for Shinde's Shiv Sena in Kalyan-Dombivli and Shinde's praise for Thackeray's broader perspective in decision-making.

title: Google AI CEO tells everyone why Gemini & ChatGPT winning International Maths Olympiad is not big
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated that AI systems solving complex Maths Olympiad problems do not prove general intelligence. These systems can still err on basic math and are 'frozen' after training. They struggle with long-term strategies and consistency across tasks. Hassabis emphasized the need for AI that learns continuously and plans for the future.

title: Domestic violence case: Supreme Court issues notice to cricketer Mohammad Shami on wife's plea
content: The Supreme Court has directed cricketer Mohammad Shami to respond to his estranged wife's plea to transfer multiple cases, including a domestic violence one, from West Bengal to Delhi.  The court issued notices to Shami and others, seeking their replies on the transfer petitions. This follows an earlier plea for increased maintenance for their daughter.

title: 'Join Galgotias as Professor of Spin': Mahua jabs Vaishnaw amid robodog row
content: ‚ÄãMahua Moitra also shared a Vaishnaw's deleted X post in which he had purportedly praised the Galgotias University's robodog, which triggered a massive backlash online over its Chinese origins. ‚Äã In the post, as was posted by the TMC leader, Vaishnaw had said: "Bharat's sovereign models are performing well on global benchmarks."

title: ‚ÄòKya karoge jaan ke‚Äô: Murdered MBA student‚Äôs boyfriend shows no remorse, smirks at reporters
content: Accused in the murder of an MBA student displayed striking indifference during a crime scene reconstruction, brushing aside reporters' questions. Police described his demeanor as unusually calm and detached, noting his claims of wanting to communicate with the victim's spirit and his consumption of occult content.

title: Ramadan Mubarak 2026: Messages to share with your friends & families
content: Ramadan 2026 begins around February 18-19 in India, marking a period of fasting, prayer, and reflection for Muslims. This sacred month, one of Islam's pillars, emphasizes spiritual growth and community. It culminates in Eid ul-Fitr on March 19-20, a joyous festival celebrating the end of the fast.

title: Rampage livestream erupts as Deen gets hit twice
content: A late-night house party hosted by former UFC star Quinton ‚ÄúRampage‚Äù Jackson turned chaotic after a physical fight broke out between retired MMA fighter Tiki Ghosn and streamer Deen The Great. The confrontation was streamed live. The clips of the party went viral on social media. Viewers watched as a verbal argument escalated in front of guests.

title: Larry Wheels slaps Deen the Great on Rampage livestream
content: The ‚ÄúFAFO‚Äù trend actions, bringing quick consequences, played out live on camera this week. Boxer Deen the Great, whose real name is Nurideen Shahid Shabazz, was involved in an awkward confrontation during Quinton ‚ÄúRampage‚Äù Jackson‚Äôs double-date livestream. What began as a relaxed and friendly stream quickly turned tense after Deen the Great approached powerlifter and influencer Larry Wheels and his wife, Sheyla Wheels.

title: Mavericks‚Äô Kyrie Irving out for season, ACL recovery begins
content: Dallas Mavericks star Kyrie Irving will miss the remainder of the season as he continues to recover from March knee surgery. The nine-time All-Star is expected to return for the 2026-2027 season, prioritizing a full recovery to chase a championship next year. This decision aligns with the Mavericks' current rebuilding phase.

title: Three ducks in a row: Abhishek out for zero vs NED; yet to score a run in T20 WC
content: Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup campaign hit a new low as he registered his third consecutive duck against the Netherlands. The left-handed batter was dismissed for a first-ball duck by Aryan Dutt. India, having already qualified for the Super Eights, elected to bat first in their final group stage match.

title: Sahibzada Farhan: Once made documentary on hitting sixes off Bumrah, now a World Cup centurion
content: Never short of headlines, Sahibzada Farhan completed a full-circle moment with a scintillating T20 World Cup century against Namibia in Colombo. From challenging selection norms and going unsold in the PSL to becoming only Pakistan‚Äôs second World Cup centurion. Pakistan defeated Namibia by 102 runs to cement their place in the Super Eight

title: Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara full price list revealed: Check variant-wise pricing, features
content: Features-wise, it gets a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster, a 10.1-inch infotainment screen supported by wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, cloud-based navigation, panoramic sunroof, ambient lighting with 12 colour options and ventilated front seats. Apart from that, it gets features such as wireless charging, a JBL sound system, automatic climate control, multiple USB ports, and an in-cabin air purifier.

title: Ryan Williams, 19, engaged to Alexis Hill, 25 amid breakout season
content: Alabama wide receiver Ryan Williams, 19, announced his engagement to 25-year-old Alexis Hill on Valentine‚Äôs Day. Hill, who has one child from a previous relationship, shared photos of her ring on Instagram. NFL insider Dov Kleiman reported the news on X, leading to mixed reactions online. Some fans celebrated, while others debated the couple‚Äôs six-year age gap.

title: Sit, stay, run: Dog gatecrashes Olympic sprint, crosses finish line - watch
content: A surprise guest stole the show at the Milan-Cortina Winter Games. An unregistered dog dashed onto the cross-country ski course during the women's team free sprint. The enthusiastic canine chased competitors, even crossing the finish line. Officials eventually intervened, escorting the four-legged interloper off the piste. His unscheduled Olympic bid ended abruptly.

title: Diamond-shaped house in Hyderabad turns luxury real estate into legacy
content: Hyderabad's real estate boasts a unique diamond-shaped house. This structure represents P. P. Reddy's journey from humble beginnings to infrastructure giant. Its design mirrors ambition and success. Such landmark homes derive value from unique architecture, prime location, and compelling personal narratives. This residence stands as a testament to persistence and vision, a biography etched in stone and steel.

title: More trouble for Galgotias University? After Chinese robodog, Korean soccer drone
content: Galgotias University is under renewed scrutiny at the India AI Impact Summit. Following controversy over a robotic dog, the institution now faces questions about a drone soccer arena. Faculty claimed it as an in-house innovation, but social media users point to similar commercially available products from South Korea. The university was asked to vacate its stall at the summit.

title: Pakistan in T20 World Cup Super 8, become eighth team to advance
content: Pakistan secured their Super Eight spot in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026, becoming the final qualifier. They joined powerhouses like India, West Indies, and England in the next phase. The tournament's top two from each group have advanced, setting up two exciting groups of four for the Super 8 stage.

title: 'India doesn't negotiate as a meek nation': Piyush Goyal on recent trade deals
content: Piyush Goyal revealed India's ambitious economic diplomacy, emphasising engagement and trust to achieve trade success.  He highlighted the nation's goal of becoming a $30-35 trillion economy by 2047, stressing the need for global integration.  Goyal noted India's recent success in securing trade agreements from a position of strength, while safeguarding national interests.

title: AI boom! What Nvidia wants from India to put New Delhi on the global manufacturing map
content: NVIDIA's Shanker Trivedi urged India to boost AI infrastructure investment beyond $1.2 billion, aligning with global standards. He highlighted the Union Budget's 20-year tax holiday for foreign firms as a significant chance to build foundational AI capacity. With 1,800 global corporations operating in India, each requiring local AI factories, increased capital allocation is crucial for developing intelligence-led business processes.

title: Sahibzada Farhan scripts history, becomes only 2nd Pakistan batter to achieve this feat
content: Sahibzada Farhan made history by scoring a century in the T20 World Cup. He is the second Pakistani batter to achieve this milestone. Farhan's century helped Pakistan post a strong total against Namibia. This performance was crucial for Pakistan's hopes of advancing in the tournament. The team made changes to its lineup for this important match.

title: 'Was anxious about her future after my death': Former Isro employee murders wife in Bengaluru flat
content: A former ISRO employee, Nagesh Ishwar Rao, was arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly strangling his wife, Sandhya Shri, to death. Police revealed Rao cited anxieties about his wife's future as his motive. The couple's daughter, residing in the US, has been notified. An investigation into the tragic incident is ongoing.

title: Nandan Nilekani says AI is ending these 4 IT jobs ‚Äî and creating 5 new roles soon
content: Infosys Chairman Nandan Nilekani declared AI is fundamentally reshaping tech jobs, shifting focus from coding to managing AI agents. This "root-and-branch" transformation demands new skills in AI engineering and orchestration, while roles like front-end developers and QA testers are expected to shrink. Companies face the challenge of reskilling their workforce for these evolving AI-centric roles.

title: Chinese robodog row at AI Impact Summit: Why is Galgotias University under fire? Explained
content: Galgotias University was asked to leave the AI Summit Expo after showcasing a Chinese-made robotic dog as an in-house innovation. The university clarified it did not build the robot but used it to inspire students, sparking a debate on domestic AI development versus global technology adoption.

title: NHL trade news: St. Louis Blues likely to undergo major rebuild
content: The St. Louis Blues are at a crossroads as general manager Doug Armstrong is at a juncture where he has to decide whether to go for a late-season surge or a complete rebuild. The coming month will be very important for the team, as well-placed trades and recall decisions could change the course of their history.

title: Dwarka car accident aftermath video shows brother-sister duo shifting blame on biker
content: New CCTV and mobile footage has emerged from the fatal Dwarka South crash, showing a brother and sister arguing with bystanders after the collision that killed biker Sahil Dhaneshra. The SUV, allegedly driven by a minor, had narrowly avoided a bus before hitting the motorcycle and a stationary car.

title: Traveller shares why some foreigners aren‚Äôt big fan of Indian tourists
content: An Indian traveler's experience in Vietnam highlighted how certain Indian tourists' behaviors, like aggressive bargaining and queue-jumping, negatively impacted local perceptions. Similar incidents shared by other Indians abroad underscore a recurring issue of civic sense translating poorly across borders, leading to international stereotypes.

title: Live stream to wall climbs: Bihar Class X board exams open in chaos
content: Bihar School Examination Board exams commenced with significant disruptions. A Facebook Live video from a Siwan exam centre raised security concerns. Students across districts attempted to scale walls to enter centres after arriving late. Incidents of cheating were also reported. Authorities are investigating the breaches and ensuring exam integrity.

title: PM to address AI summit on February 19, world leaders gather
content: The plenary session will bring together several heads of state and government, with PM Modi‚Äôs address followed by keynote presentations by global tech leaders

title: Culture Ministry funded event platformed incendiary ‚Äòhate speech‚Äô: Congress
content: The Congress claimed that the Sanatan Sanstha was under investigation by the Karnataka government in connection with the murders of journalist Gauri Lankesh and scholar M.M. Kalburgi

title: SOP to verify authenticity of academic and other certificates of guest faculty of degree colleges
content: A ‚ÄòCertificate Verification Committee‚Äô should be mandatorily formed in every government first-grade college to verify the authenticity of the educational certificates of the guest faculty, as per the SOP

title: Simultaneous polls panel weighs bar on no-confidence motions in final year of government‚Äôs term
content: Panel chairperson P.P. Chaudhary says Panchayati Raj laws in many States have similar restrictions, and the committee could propose introduction of a similar clause in the simultaneous polls legislation¬†¬†¬†

title: KSPL plans ‚Çπ200 crore expansion of Offshore Supply Vessel Complex
content: ¬†The Rs.200 crore expansion aims at additional handling of four MTPA of cargo, support the accommodation of Indian Navy and Coast Guard vessels and strengthening offshore logistics capability for oil and natural gas exploration in the Krishna-Godavari basin.

title: Urumi swish draws crowd to 11th¬†Ponnyathankam
content: The week-long fete is organised by Kerala Folklore Academy, Kathirur panchayat and Pattiyam Gopalan Memorial Library. What began in 2015 as a modest Kalari demonstration by a local reading room has since evolved into one of the largest martial arts congregations, drawing participants from across India and abroad

title: Kerala to regularise over 20,000 teacher posts
content: Kerala government has extended to all aided school managements the relaxation earlier granted to Nair Service Society for making permanent appointments to general category posts, subject to Supreme Court verdict. Over 20,000 provisional teachers are expected to benefit

title: Above 5,300 acres set for exclusion from Kolleru Lake in West Godavari
content: The entire land has been earmarked in the 10 villages for the exclusion as part of downsizing the Kolleru Lake.

title: ‚ÄòIndia, UK resolve to deepen cooperation in AI, next-generation telecommunications‚Äô
content: Union Minister of State for Communications Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar holds bilateral meeting with UK Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for AI and Online Safety Kanishka Narayan on the sidelines of AI Summit in New Delhi

title: TTD Chairman rubbishes Bhumana‚Äôs claim on supply of ghee by Indapur Dairy
content: Karnataka Milk Federation always remained the TTD‚Äôs biggest and dependable ghee supplier,  meeting a whopping 62% of its total requirement, says B.R. Naidu

title: Kerala has sufficient land for industrial development: Balagopal
content: Minister was addressing a round table discussion on ‚ÄòKerala‚Äôs Development: Next Stage‚Äô organised by C. Achutha Menon Foundation

title: Aalin‚Äôs death sparks a campaign for child safety in Kerala
content: The State Transport department is planning to resume the awareness campaign highlighting the need to use Child Restraint System in vehicles following the tragic death of Aalin, says C. Nagaraju, State Transport Commissioner

title: Legislative Council stalled for second day as YSRCP insists on debating TTD ghee issue
content: Council Chairman Moshenu Raju rejects its adjournment motion seeking emergency discussion on supply of ghee to the TTD by Indapur Dairy, which, it claims, has links with Heritage Foods

title: Hubballi: Strict measures are being taken to curb drugs, says DGP of Prisons
content: Alok Kumar says that inmates are being subjected to regular medical check-ups to detect any access to or use of narcotics.

title: 43 CRPF temporary operating bases created in Jammu and Kashmir post Pahalgam attack: Officials
content: Each temporary operating base houses about 16-25 troops, apart from some personnel of the local police, they said.

title: A. Suresh‚Äôs old FB post flaying Satheesan resurfaces
content: He had come down heavily on Satheesan for criticising Achuthanandan over his alleged participation in a programme linked to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh

title: NDA allies urge Nitish Kumar to review Bihar‚Äôs liquor laws
content: The JD(U), however, maintains that the policy is being reviewed from time to time, and has done good for society

title: Accused in minor girl‚Äôs rape and murder case in Madanapalle found dead
content: The body of the accused was found floating in a tank after he escaped from police vehicle; preliminary investigation suggests suicide, say police

title: Ramzan fasts to begin in India from February 19
content: Shahi Imam of Chandni Chowk's Fatehpuri mosque Maulana Mufti Mukarram Ahmed announced that the crescent moon was sighted and the month of fasting will start from February 19

title: A decade on, DCIP continues to link youth with governance in Kozhikode
content: District Collector‚Äôs Internship Programme was launched in June 2015 as part of the Compassionate Kozhikode project in association with the Indian Institute of Management, Kozhikode

title: Two popular hill destinations in Kerala tell contrasting tales of tourism
content: While Idukki records arrival of 46.79 lakh domestic tourists in 2025, Wayanad attracts only 14.73 lakh tourists in the same year. Landslides in Wayanad in 2024 seems to have severely affected the tourism prospects of the destination

title: GST rationalisation likely to impact Karnataka‚Äôs Budget size
content: With GST rate rationalisation pinching revenue collection, Karnataka government is not only expecting a widening of fiscal deficit, but also the overall goal of having a nominal revenue surplus budget slip away by a couple of years

title: QR code-based footwear management system improves devotee convenience, hygiene in Tirumala
